text: these happy newlyweds saban Kesser
are trying to put the past behind them
but her scars make it hard to forget
just a few weeks ago she quietly married
the love of her life against the wishes
of her family the day after the marriage
Saba's father and uncle took her from a
new home and tried to kill her subber
told me that she didn't think she would
survive it was a dark and moonless night
when they stopped the car by the canal I
asked them what are you going to do they
slapped me and fired at me they wanted
to kill me and when one will it passed
through my hand they fired again this
time it grazed my cheek and that's when
I fainted they threw me into the canal
it was only when I hit the water that I
came around I grabbed a hold of some
weeds and pulled myself out her father
muscled devid and her uncle are being
held in this jail on charges of
attempted murder and kidnap I just met
with Savas father Massoud here in the
Central Jail Gaurav Allah we weren't
allowed to take any recording equipment
with us into a small clothes room behind
bars he said he had not committed any
crime he just wanted to teach his
daughter that no girl his family should
ever elope but in Pakistan while nearly
nine hundred honor killings were
reported last year such crimes often go
unpunished the law unfortunately is very
flawed and weighed in favor of impunity
for honor killings because in most cases
it will end in a compromise because the
family will first conspire to kill the
woman and then conspire to get into a
compromise and forget forgive the person
was actually pulled the trigger
negotiations are already underway for an
out-of-court settlement
Saba says she doesn't want to forgive
her family but her in-laws and community
elders are pressuring her since the
attempt on her life Saba has met neither
her mother nor her siblings she says
she'll never go back to her family her
scars are healing but it is on
likely that they were fade ambush MC BBC
news good traveler
